title: Japanese battleship Yamashiro
summary: Yamashiro (山城, "Mountain castle", named for Yamashiro Province) was the second of two  Fusō-class dreadnought battleships built for the Imperial Japanese Navy. Launched in 1915 and commissioned in 1917, she initially patrolled off the coast of China, playing no part in World War I. In 1923, she assisted survivors of the Great Kantō earthquake.
